descriptions.description: GLib provides advanced data structures, such as memory chunks, doubly and singly linked lists, hash tables, dynamic strings and string utilities, such as a lexical scanner, string chunks (groups of strings), dynamic arrays, keyed data lists, relations and tuples and routines for memory management and threads.

comments.comment:
While compiling in /work/glib-2.36.4/docs/reference/glib make tells us, it needs automake-1.13 (and autoconf, m4, perl). The configure switches --disable-gtk-doc and --disable-gtk-doc-html were ignored. You could remove "docs" from SUBDIRS in Makefile.in. If all fails, install gtk-doc and run "autoreconf -fi".
Reason: Makefile.in for some Makefile.am's that include gtk-doc.make have timestamp a bit older than gtk-doc.make, causing attempt to regenerate Makefile.in. That success only if system automake is same version than one used in tarball creation system (1.13.1). Other versions complain about incompatibility.
This should work:
cat Makefile.inBAK | sed \ -e 's|po docs|po|g' \ -e 's|cd docs && make glib.html|#cd docs && make glib.html|g' > Makefile.in
Faster workaround:
pushd . cd docs/reference find -type f -name Makefile.in -exec touch {} \; popd

set.commands:
PACKAGE_NAME=glib PACKAGE_VERSION=2.36.4
oegimport libiconv oegimport zlib oegimport libffi # required oegimport gettext # required oegimport pcre #oegimport python # compile-time only; really needed? oegimport libxml2 # compile-time only? oegimport libxslt # compile-time only? #oegimport libiconv #oegimport gettext oegimport zlib
oegextract ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}.tar.xz
oegpatch 001 # missed a cast in test program gdatetime.exe
mkdir -p "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}/packages/${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}" cp AUTHORS COPYING README "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}/packages/${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}/"
configure --prefix=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --with-sysroot=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --with-gnu-ld --bindir=${OEG_BASE_BIN_DIR} --libdir=${OEG_BASE_LIB_DIR} ${CONFIGURE_HOST_PARA} --with-threads=win32 --with-libiconv=gnu --with-pcre=system # --with-pcre=internal
# If make breaks while being in docs/reference (see comment): pushd . cd docs/reference find -type f -name Makefile.in -exec touch {} \; popd
make make install-strip DESTDIR=${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}
cd "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}"
mv bin/*.dll bin64/ rm -rf bin # TODO: Do we need to edit the .la files in lib64?
oegarchive ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}
